spass

Class ValueDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • spass.ValueDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ValueDisplay
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A GUI display that shows a graphical representation of an quadratic array of floating point numbers. There are no limitations for the values in that array. The ValueDisplay will normalize the values so that the lowest value is mapped to zero, and the highest value is mapped to 255. The distribution of the values between the minimum and the maximum can be either linear or logarithmic. It is also possible to mask some values of the input array, so that they will not be displayed (and not taken into account when determining the minimum and maximum).
    Author:
    Oliver Eickmeyer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ValueDisplay

        public ValueDisplay(int size,
                    double[] values)
        Constructs display for a quadratic image of the given size. The size is the length of one dimension of the image.
        Parameters:
        size - size of one dimension of the quadratic image
        values - quadratic array with values to be displayed

        values - the array with the values to be displayed
        mask - an optional boolean array of equal size; or null

      • doubleToImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage doubleToImage(int size,
                                                         double[] values,
                                                         boolean[] mask,
                                                         boolean log)
        Creates an image of gray values out of the given array. The array values will be normalized into a range from 0 to 1. If mask is not null, the values will be masked before. A value will be set to zero if the corresponding mask entry is false.
        Parameters:
        size - size of one dimension of the quadratic arrays
        values - array of gray values
        mask - a masking array to be applied to the values before normalizing
        log - true activates logarithmic mode
        Returns:
        image created out of the array

      • doubleToByteArray

        public static byte[] doubleToByteArray(double[] d,
                                       boolean[] mask,
                                       boolean log)
        Converts an quadratic two-dimensional array of floating point values into an equally sized array of unsigned bytes. It will also be normalized (lowest value maps to zero and highest value maps to 255). If log is true, the values between 0 and 255 will be distributed logarithmically; otherwise linearly. If mask is not null, the values will be masked before. A value will be set to zero if the corresponding mask entry is false.
        Parameters:
        d - array of double precision values to be converted to bytes
        mask - a masking array to be applied to the array before
        log - true activates logarithmic mode
        Returns:
        quadratic byte array

      • doubleToByteArrayLin

        public static byte[] doubleToByteArrayLin(double[] d,
                                          boolean[] mask)
        Converts an quadratic two-dimensional array of floating point values into an equally sized array of unsigned bytes. It will also be normalized (lowest value maps to zero and highest value maps to 255). If mask is not null, the values will be masked before. A value will be set to zero if the corresponding mask entry is false.
        Parameters:
        d - array of double precision values to be converted to bytes
        mask - a masking array to be applied to the array before
        Returns:
        quadratic byte array

      • doubleToByteArrayLog

        public static byte[] doubleToByteArrayLog(double[] d,
                                          boolean[] mask)
        Converts an quadratic two-dimensional array of floating point values into an equally sized array of unsigned bytes. It will also be normalized (lowest value maps to zero and highest value maps to 255). The values between 0 and 255 will be distributed logarithmically. If mask is not null, the values will be masked before. A value will be set to zero if the corresponding mask entry is false.
        Parameters:
        d - array of double precision values to be converted to bytes
        mask - a masking array to be applied to the array before
        Returns:
        quadratic byte array

        Calculates the image-related coordinates of the given pixel-position in this ValueDisplay.
        Parameters:

        y - - y-position in this ValueDisplay
        Returns:

        Calculates the index of the value related to the given pixel-position in this ValueDisplay.
        Parameters:
        x - - x-position in this ValueDisplay
        y - - y-position in this ValueDisplay
        Returns:
        index of the given position; or -1 if the index would be out of bounds

      • isLog

        public boolean isLog()
        Checks if logarithmic mode is active.
        Returns:
        true if logarithmic mode is active; false otherwise
